train module

train.find_best_solver(logistic_regression_solvers, X_train, y_train, X_test, y_test) → str

Find the best solver for Logistic Regression

Parameters:

  • logistic_regression_solvers – list with logistic regression solvers

  • X_train – dataframe with feature value from training set

  • y_train – series with the train set target values

  • X_test – dataframe with feature value from test set

  • y_test – series with the test set target values

Returns:

best solver obtained

train.load_parquet_data(file_path: str) → DataFrame

Load data from .parquet file.

Parameters:

file_path – location where the file will be saved

Returns:

dataframe with file content

train.save_confusion_matrix(model, y_test: Series, y_pred: Series, file_path: str) → None

Save model confusion matrix.

Parameters:

  • model – model used in training

  • y_test – series with the test set target values

  • y_pred – series with the values predicted by the model

Returns:

train.save_model(model, file_path: str) → None

Save model in a .pickle file.

Parameters:

  • model – model used in training

  • file_path – location where the file will be saved

Returns:

None

train.save_results(model, file_path: str, y_test: Series, y_pred: Series) → None

Save performance results in a file_path

Parameters:

  • model – model used in training

  • file_path – path where the results will be saved

  • y_test – series with the test set target values

  • y_pred – series with the values predicted by the model

Returns:

None

train.split_data(features_data: ~pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, target_date: ~pandas.core.series.Series) -> (<class 'pandas.core.frame.DataFrame'>, <class 'pandas.core.frame.DataFrame'>, <class 'pandas.core.series.Series'>, <class 'pandas.core.series.Series'>)

Split data for training.

Parameters:

  • features_data – dataframe with features values

  • target_date – series with target values

Returns:

split data

train.train(X_train: DataFrame, y_train: Series, best_solver: str)

Train Logistic Regression Model.

Parameters:

  • X_train – dataframe with feature value from training set

  • y_train – series with the train set target values

Returns:

Logistic Regression Model
